articles.title: Pick your agent: Use Claude and Codex on Agent HQ
articles.description: Claude by Anthropic and OpenAI Codex are now available in public preview on GitHub and VS Code with a Copilot Pro+ or Copilot Enterprise subscription. Here's what you need to know and how to get started today. The post Pick your agent: Use Claude and Codex on Agent HQ appeared first on The GitHub Bl
articles.content: Context switching equals friction in software development. Today, we’re removing some of that friction with the latest updates to Agent HQ which lets you run coding agents from multiple providers directly inside GitHub and your editor, keeping context, history, and review attached to your work. Copilot Pro+ and Copilot Enterprise users can now run multiple coding agents directly inside GitHub, GitHub Mobile, and Visual Studio Code (with Copilot CLI support coming soon). That means you can
articles.author: Mario Rodriguez

articles.title: Overwatch will drop the '2' as Jetpack Cat and four other heroes arrive on February 10
articles.description: Blizzard is running a series of showcases for several of its major franchises and on Wednesday, it was time for Overwatch to step up to the plate. That’s Overwatch, by the way, and not Overwatch 2 . The studio is formally nixing the number from the game's name. "Overwatch is more than just a dig
articles.content: Blizzard is running a series of showcases for several of its major franchises and on Wednesday, it was time for Overwatch to step up to the plate. That’s Overwatch, by the way, and not Overwatch 2 . The studio is formally nixing the number from the game's name. "Overwatch is more than just a digit: it's a living universe that keeps growing, keeps surprising, and keeps bringing players together from around the world," the Overwatch team said in a statement. "This year marks a huge turning
articles.author: Kris Holt

articles.title: OpenClaw’s AI ‘skill’ extensions are a security nightmare
articles.description: OpenClaw, the AI agent that has exploded in popularity over the past week, is raising new security concerns after researchers uncovered malware in hundreds of user-submitted "skill" add-ons on its marketplace. In a post on Monday, 1Password product VP Jason Meller says OpenClaw's skill hub has becom
articles.content: OpenClaw, the AI agent that has exploded in popularity over the past week, is raising new security concerns after researchers uncovered malware in hundreds of user-submitted "skill" add-ons on its marketplace. In a post on Monday , 1Password product VP Jason Meller says OpenClaw's skill hub has become "an attack surface," with the most-downloaded add-on serving as a "malware delivery vehicle." OpenClaw - first called Clawdbot, then Moltbot - is billed as an AI agent that "actually does things,"
articles.author: Emma Roth

articles.title: CI-Embedded Security
articles.description: Check before you wreck Part of The Coercion Saga — making AI write quality code. Linters catch your mistakes. Type checkers catch your assumptions. But what about security? That's a different beast entirely. Three attack surfaces. Three different problems. Dependencies — Other people's code. You ins
articles.content: Check before you wreck Part of The Coercion Saga — making AI write quality code. Linters catch your mistakes. Type checkers catch your assumptions. But what about security? That's a different beast entirely. Three attack surfaces. Three different problems. Dependencies — Other people's code. You install a package. It works. Six months later, someone discovers a critical vulnerability. It's been in your production code the whole time. You had no idea. Your code — The stuff you write. SQL injectio
articles.author: nicolas.vbgh

One potential source of electricity for these facilities is next-generation nuclear power plants , which could be cheaper to construct and safer to operate than thei

articles.title: Bezos orders deep job cuts at 'Washington Post'
articles.description: The Washington Post embarked on severe cuts despite appeals by the newsroom to owner Jeff Bezos. The paper is to narrow its focus largely to politics and national security.
articles.content: The Washington Post has been the leading newspaper in the nation's capital for decades. Now it's making deep cuts to every department in the newsroom.'/> The Washington Post embarked on severe cuts despite appeals by the newsroom to owner Jeff Bezos. The paper is to narrow its focus largely to politics and national security. (Image credit: Nicholas Kamm)

articles.title: "Capture it all": ICE urged to explain memo about collecting info on protesters
articles.description: Sen. Markey: Database of peaceful protesters, if it exists, should be shut down.
articles.content: Senator Edward J. Markey (D-Mass.) demanded that Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) confirm or deny the existence of a "domestic terrorists” database that lists US citizens who protest ICE's immigration crackdown. ICE "officers and senior Trump administration officials have repeatedly suggested that the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) is building a 'domestic terrorists' database comprising information on US citizens protesting ICE’s actions in recent weeks," Markey wrote in a letter
articles.author: Jon Brodkin

This article is the prescription. The question every CEO is now getting from their board is some version of: What
articles.content: The previous article in this series, “ Rules fail at the prompt, succeed at the boundary ,” focused on the first AI-orchestrated espionage campaign and the failure of prompt-level control. This article is the prescription. The question every CEO is now getting from their board is some version of: What do we do about agent risk? Across recent AI security guidance from standards bodies, regulators, and major providers, a simple idea keeps repeating: treat agents like powerful, semi-autonomous user

articles.title: What the fastest-growing tools reveal about how software is being built
articles.description: What languages are growing fastest, and why? What about the projects that people are interested in the most? Where are new developers cutting their teeth? Let’s take a look at Octoverse data to find out. The post What the fastest-growing tools reveal about how software is being built appeared first
articles.content: In 2025, software development crossed a quiet threshold. In our latest Octoverse report , we found that the fastest-growing languages, tools, and open source projects on GitHub are no longer about shipping more code. Instead, they’re about reducing friction in a world where AI is helping developers build more, faster. By looking at some of the areas of fastest growth over the past year, we can see how developers are adapting through: The programming languages that are growing most in AI-as
articles.author: Dylan Birtolo

articles.content: This is today’s edition of The Download , our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. articles.title: Music Is Memory With a Rhythm
articles.description: A song can pull you years back in seconds. Not because of the lyrics — but because of how it felt. Tempo, tone, and repetition attach themselves to moments: late nights long drives quiet rooms That’s why hearing an old song feels personal. It’s not nostalgia. It’s recall. Music doesn’t just play. It
articles.content: A song can pull you years back in seconds. Not because of the lyrics — but because of how it felt. Tempo, tone, and repetition attach themselves to moments: late nights long drives quiet rooms That’s why hearing an old song feels personal. It’s not nostalgia. It’s recall. Music doesn’t just play. It reminds. We don’t just hear music. We remember through it. – Serguey Asael Shinder
articles.author: Serguey Asael Shinder

articles.title: User blowback convinces Adobe to keep supporting 30-year-old 2D animation app
articles.description: Despite the about-face, some customers think "the damage is done."
articles.content: Adobe has canceled plans to discontinue its 2D animation software Animate. On Monday, Adobe announced that it would stop allowing people to sell subscriptions to Animate on March 1, saying the software had “served its purpose." People who already had a software license would be able to keep using Animate with technical support until March 1, 2027; businesses had until March 1, 2029. Per an email sent to customers, Adobe also said users would lose access to Animate files and project data on March
articles.author: Scharon Harding

articles.title: Roblox’s '4D' creation toolset is now available in open beta
articles.description: Roblox launched an open-source AI model that generates 3D objects on the fly early last year and now that toolset is getting a massive boost. The platform has introduced a model that whips up "4D" objects . I put 4D in quotes because it doesn't actually allow access to the fourth dimension, but
articles.content: Roblox launched an open-source AI model that generates 3D objects on the fly early last year and now that toolset is getting a massive boost. The platform has introduced a model that whips up "4D" objects . I put 4D in quotes because it doesn't actually allow access to the fourth dimension, but rather lets users make interactive 3D objects via prompts. As suggested, these aren't static 3D models. They are fully functional and interactive objects that move and react to players. The beta t
articles.author: Lawrence Bonk

articles.content: Hot on the heels of AGDQ in January, Games Done Quick is hosting its second speedrunning event of the year, Back to Black 2026, starting tomorrow, February 5. The four-day event is organized by Black in a Flash and is raising money for Race Forward , a nonprofit that works across communities to address systemic racism. Back to Black is timed to the start of Black History Month and highlights the deep bench of talent in the Black speedrunning community. A few runs, like ones for Hades II , Donkey

articles.title: Overwatch: all the news about Blizzard’s hit hero shooter
articles.description: Overwatch 2, the sequel to Activision Blizzard’s hit hero shooter Overwatch, was announced in 2019 but didn’t arrive for another three years, eventually bringing a shift to five-on-five matches in PVP, and a few new characters, including Overwatch’s first Black female hero. After canceling planned P
articles.content: Overwatch 2 , the sequel to Activision Blizzard’s hit hero shooter Overwatch , was announced in 2019 but didn’t arrive for another three years, eventually bringing a shift to five-on-five matches in PVP, and a few new characters, including Overwatch’s first Black female hero . After canceling planned PvE content and unlocking its hero pool, the game’s developers eventually brought back a lot of things, like 6v6 gameplay, loot boxes , and, in 2026, its name. Overwatch 2 is now just Overwatch agai
articles.author: Verge Staff

In the wide-ranging hearing, Bhattacharya defended the chaotic and disruptive cuts at the institutes he helms while carefully wording responses related to vaccines—seemingly to avoid contradicting his boss, anti-vaccine Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. As Bhattacharya testified, Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-
articles.author: Beth Mole

articles.title: The best digital frames for 2026
articles.description: A digital photo frame shouldn’t be complicated. At its best, it’s just a good-looking screen that can be set up quickly that reliably shows the photos you care about. Unfortunately, that’s not always how things play out. The market is flooded with cheap digital frames that promise simplicity but end
articles.content: A digital photo frame shouldn’t be complicated. At its best, it’s just a good-looking screen that can be set up quickly that reliably shows the photos you care about. Unfortunately, that’s not always how things play out. The market is flooded with cheap digital frames that promise simplicity but end up delivering washed-out displays, clunky apps and a frustrating experience — leading you to abandon it after a week. That’s a shame, because a good digital frame can be really enjoyable. Most of us
articles.author: Nathan Ingraham

articles.title: Russian spy satellites have intercepted EU communications satellites
articles.description: Unencrypted European communications are being targeted by Moscow.
articles.content: European security officials believe two Russian space vehicles have intercepted the communications of at least a dozen key satellites over the continent. Officials believe that the likely interceptions, which have not previously been reported, risk not only compromising sensitive information transmitted by the satellites but could also allow Moscow to manipulate their trajectories or even crash them. Russian space vehicles have shadowed European satellites more intensively over the past three ye
articles.author: Sam Jones, Peggy Hollinger, and Ian Bott, Financial Times
